security.title: Security
security.security1: Creation and change secured by e-mail based challenge and response
security.security2:
Trade-Off security vs. data protection
  • More security would mean more information to store.
  • What is the probability for a comprimised e-mail account to be used to change the forwarding target and create damage?
  • On broad demand improvements possible.
    Increase of cost as possible consequence.

known_challenges1.title: Known challenges (1/2)
known_challenges1.kc1:
Organisation (Affiliation) not in the authors line
  • Therefore the ORCID-ID and the ORCID-Profil supposed to be used.
  • No obligation to use scienceauthors.e-mail.
  • Mainly attractive for mobile academics.
known_challenges1.kc2: Forwarfing for old e-mail Addresses (alumni) via @scienceauthors.e-mail in evaluation = Add-On Service

known_challenges2.title: Known challenges (2/2)
known_challenges2.kc3:
Why don't authors not just use their private (or acm or ieee) e-mail Addresses?
  • Speration of work and private desirable
  • scienceauthors.e-mail looks more professional then hotmail.com oder gmail.com
known_challenges2.kc4: Authentification via ORCID and connection with profile would contradict the target data minimisation but would be available mid-term on broad demand
known_challenges2.kc5: There is a need to establish an abuse business process.
